text: At first the Faith moved mountains only when absolutely necessary, so that the landscape remained the same for millennia. But when the faith began to spread and people found the idea of moving mountains amusing, they moved from place to place, and it became increasingly difficult to find them where you had left them the night before; which of course created more difficulties than you solved. The good people then preferred to abandon the Faith and now the mountains usually remain in their place. When a road crash kills several travelers, someone, far away or nearby, had a slight glimmer of faith. The Black Sheep and Other Fables, 1969
title: La fe y las montañas
author: Augusto Monterroso
